author: Marcel Proust

quote: What I cannot love  I overlook.
author: Anais Nin

quote: A loving relationship is one in which the loved one is free to be himself - to laugh with me  but never at me  to cry with me  but never because of me  to love life  to love himself  to love being loved. Such a relationship is based upon freedom and can never grow in a jealous heart.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: Love is a canvas furnished by nature and embroidered by imagination.
author: Voltaire

quote: Love is the only sane and satisfactory answer to the problem of human existence.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: We are all born for love  it is the principle of existence and its only end.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Love is the only thing that we can carry with us when we go  and it makes the end so easy.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: Among those whom I like or admire  I can find no common denominator  but among those whom I love  I can: all of them make me laugh.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Life isn't long enough for love and art.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: The essence of love is kindness.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Love . . . includes fellowship in suffering  in joy and in effort.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: When the power of love overcomes the love of power  the world will know peace.
author: Jimi Hendrix

quote: Love is anterior to life Posterior to death Initial of creation  and The exponent of breath.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Who will tell whether one happy moment of love or the joy of breathing or walking on a bright morning and smelling the fresh air  is not worth all the suffering and effort which life implies.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: Be glad of life because it gives you the chance to love and to work and to play and to look up at the stars.
author: Henry Van Dyke

quote: Love is ever the beginning of Knowledge as fire is of light.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Life in common among people who love each other is the ideal of happiness.
author: George Sand

quote: I wonder what memories of yours will persist as you go on in life. My hunch is that the most important will have to do with feelings of loving and being loved - whoever's been close to you. As you continue to grow  you'll find many ways of expressing your love and you'll discover more and more ways in which others express their love for you.
author: Fred Rogers

quote: Where love is  no room is too small.
author: Talmud

quote: If music be the food of love  play on  Give me excess of it  that  surfeiting  The appetite may sicken  and so die. That strain again! it had a dying fall: O  it came o'er my ear like the sweet sound.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: They say a person needs just three things to be truly happy in this world: someone to love  something to do  and something to hope for.
author: Tom Bodett

quote: It is love  not reason  that is stronger than death.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: Love feels no burden  regards not labors  strives toward more than it attains  argues not of impossibility  since it believes that it may and can do all things. Therefore it avails for all things  and fulfils and accomplishes much where one not a lover falls and lies helpless.
author: Thomas a Kempis

quote: Love your neighbor as yourself  but don't take down the fence.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: There is no better exercise for strengthening the heart than reaching down and lifting up another.
author: Anonymous

quote: Love does not dominate  it cultivates.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Life is pain and the enjoyment of love is an anesthetic.
author: Cesare Pavese

quote: Love is letting go of fear.
author: Gerald Jampolsky

quote: If we all discovered that we only had five minutes left to say all that we wanted to say  every telephone booth would be occupied by people calling other people to tell them that they loved them.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: Love doesn't make the world go round  Love is what makes the ride worthwhile.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: Age does not protect you from love. But love  to some extent  protects you from age.
author: Jeanne Moreau

quote: And remember  my sentimental friend  that a heart is not judged by how much you love  but by how much you are loved by others.
author: L. Frank Baum

quote: Love's like the measles - all the worse when it comes late in life.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: Ofttimes the test of courage becomes rather to live than to die.
author: Vittorio Conte Alfieri

quote: Every man's life is a fairy-tale written by God's fingers.
author: Hans Christian Andersen

quote: Life is a jig saw puzzle with most of the pieces missing.
author: Anonymous

quote: I expect to pass through this world but once. Any good therefore that I can do  or any kindness that I can show to any fellow creature  let me do it now. Let me not defer or neglect it  for I shall not pass this way again.
author: Anonymous

quote: We come and we cry  and that is life  we yawn and we depart  and that is death!
author: Ausone de Chancel

quote: It matters not how long we live  but how.
author: Francis Bailey

quote: Life is a long lesson in humility.
author: Sir James Matthew Barrie

quote: It is a misery to be born  a pain to live  a trouble to die.
author: St. Bernard of Clairvaux

quote: Life is but a day at most.
author: James Drummond Burns

quote: One life - a little gleam of Time between two Eternities.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Hurried and worried until we're buried  and there's no curtain call  Life's a very funny proposition  after all.
author: George M. Cohan

quote: For life in general  there is but one decree: youth is a blunder  manhood a struggle  old age a regret.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Out of sleeping a waking  Out of waking a sleep.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Our whole life is like a play.
author: Ben Jonson

quote: No one is to be despaired of as long as he breathes. (While there is life there is hope.)
author: Erasmus

quote: Dost thou love life? Then do not squander time  for that is the stuff life is made of.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: A useless life is an early death.
author: Goethe

quote: All that a man hath will he give for his life.
author: Bible

quote: Life is a tragedy for those who feel  and a comedy for those who think.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: Every life is many days  day after day. We walk through ourselves  meeting robbers  ghosts  giants  old men  young men  wives  widows  brothers-in-love. But always meeting ourselves.
author: James Joyce

quote: Tell me not  in mournful numbers  Life is but an empty dream!
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Christian life consists in faith and charity.
author: Martin Luther

quote: Strait is the gate and narrow is the way which leadeth unto life.
author: Matthew

quote: My candle burns at both ends  It will not last the night  But  ah  my foes  and  oh  my friends -  It gives a lovely light.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote: Ah Love! could you and I with him conspire To grasp this sorry Scheme of Things entire Would we not shatter it to bits - and then Re-mould it nearer to the Heart's Desire?
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: Life is the game that must be played: This truth at least  good friends  we know  So live and laugh  nor be dismayed As one by one the phantoms go.
author: Edwin Arlington Robinson

quote: I wish to preach not the doctrine of ignoble ease  but the doctrine of the strenuous life.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: As is a tale  so is life: not how long it is  but how good it is  is what matters.
author: Seneca

quote: His saying was: live and let live.
author: Friedrich von Schiller

quote: Out  out  brief candle! Life's but a walking shadow.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: May you live all the days of your life.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Let your life lightly dance on the edges of Time like dew on the tip of a leaf.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: The white flower of a blameless life.
author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

quote: Life is a game of whist. From unseen sources The cards are shuffled  and the hands are dealt. I do not like the way the cards are shuffled  But yet I like the game and want to play.
author: Eugene F. Ware

quote: Men know life too early  women know life too late.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: All the things I really like to do are either immoral  illegal or fattening.
author: Alexander Woollcott

quote: And God said  Let there be light: and there was light.
author: Bible

quote: The true light  which lighteth every man that cometh into the world.
author: Bible

quote: He was a burning and a shining light.
author: Bible

quote: Lead  kindly Light  amid the encircling gloom  Lead Thou me on! The night is dark  and I am far from home -  Lead Thou me on! Keep Thou my feet  I do not ask to see The distant scene  - one step enough for me.
author: John Henry Newman

quote: And this I know  whether the one True Light Kindle to Love  or Wrath consume me quite  One flash of it within the Tavern caught Better than in the temple lost outright.
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: Nature and Nature's laws lay hid in night: God said  "Let Newton be!" and all was light.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: A light heart lives long.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The one important thing I have learned over the years is the difference between taking one's work seriously and taking one's self seriously. The first is imperative and the second is disastrous.
author: Margot Fonteyn

quote: Man  unlike the animal  has never learned that the sole purpose of life is to enjoy it.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: There is no cure for birth or death save to enjoy the interval.
author: George Santayana

quote: Life's better when it's fun. Boy  that's deep  isn't it?
author: Kevin Costner

quote: When a man is gloomy  everything seems to go wrong  when he is cheerful  everything seems right!
author: Bible

quote: An ounce of cheerfulness is worth a pound of sadness to serve God with.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Years back someone said cod liver oil was the cure-all! Cheerfulness is more palliative and with no unpleasant aftertaste.
author: Sr. Mary Christelle Macaluso

quote: Cheerfulness keeps up a kind of daylight in the mind  filling it with a steady and perpetual serenity.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: The highest wisdom is continual cheerfulness  such a state  like the region above the moon  is always clear and serene.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Let us be of good cheer  remembering that misfortunes hardest to bear are those which never come.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Burdens become light when cheerfully borne.
author: Ovid

quote: A happy woman is one who has no cares at all  a cheerful woman is one who has cares but doesn't let them get her down.
author: Beverly Sills

quote: Even if we can't be happy we must always be cheerful.
author: Irving Kristol

quote: Nature intended you to be the fountain-spring of cheerfulness and social life  and not the mountain of despair and melancholy.
author: Sir Arthur Helps

quote: You find yourself refreshed by the presence of cheerful people. Why not make an earnest effort to confer that pleasure on others? Half the battle is gained if you never allow yourself to say anything gloomy.
author: Lydia Maria Child

quote: Cheerfulness is contagious  but don't wait to catch it from others. Be a carrier.
author: Anonymous

quote: If God came in and said  "I want you to be happy for the rest of your life " what would you do?
author: Bernie Siegel

quote: True happiness is to understand our duties toward God and man  to enjoy the present  without anxious dependence on the future  not to amuse ourselves with either hopes or fears  but to rest satisfied with what we have  which is abundantly sufficient.
author: Seneca

quote: Many people think that if they were only in some other place  or had some other job  they would be happy. Well  that is doubtful. So get as much happiness out of what you are doing as you can and don't put off being happy until some future date.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: You're happiest while you're making the greatest contribution.
author: Robert F. Kennedy

quote: The happiest and most contented people are those who each day perform to make the best of their abilities.
author: Alfred A. Montapert

quote: None but those who are happy in themselves can make others so.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Do you want a world with . . . more joy and happiness? Then find your own joy and happiness and contribute to the joy and happiness of others.
author: Bo Lozoff

quote: One thing I know  the only ones among you who will be really happy are those who will have sought and found how to serve.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: Happiness is a perfume which you cannot pour on someone without getting some on yourself.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Remember that happiness is as contagious as gloom. It should be the first duty of those who are happy to let others know of their gladness.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: Those who are happiest are those who do the most for others.
author: Booker T. Washington

quote: Make people happy and there will not be half the quarreling  or a tenth part of the wickedness there now is.
author: Lydia Maria Child

quote: Lead the life that will make you kindly and friendly to everyone about you  and you will be surprised what a happy life you will lead.
author: Charles Schwab

quote: If you want to be happy  set yourself a goal that commands your thoughts  liberates your energy  and inspires your hopes. Happiness is within you. It comes from doing some certain thing into which you can put all your thought and energy. If you want to be happy  get enthusiastic about something.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: The way to happiness: keep your heart free from hate  your mind from worry. Live simply  expect little  give much. Fill your life with love. Scatter sunshine. Forget self  think of others. Do as you would be done by. Try this for a week and you will be surprised.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

quote: The happiness of life is made up of minute fractions - the little  soon-forgotten charities of a kiss or smile  a kind look  a heartfelt compliment  and the countless infinitesimals of pleasurable and genial feeling.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: A happy life is made up of little things . . . a gift sent  a letter written  a call made  a recommendation given  transportation provided  a cake made  a book lent  a check sent.
author: Carol Holmes

quote: Do not worry  eat three square meals a day  say your prayers  be courteous to your creditors  keep your digestion good  exercise  go slow and easy. Maybe there are other things your special case requires to make you happy  but my friend  these I reckon will give you a good life.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: The secret of happiness is this: Let your interests be as wide as possible  and let your reactions to the things and persons that interest you be as far as possible friendly rather than hostile.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: The secret of happiness is not in doing what one likes  but in liking what one does.
author: J. M. Barrie

quote: The secret of happiness is to count your blessings while others are adding up their troubles.
author: William Penn

quote: The secret of happiness is to count your blessings - not your birthdays.
author: Shannon Rose

quote: To be without some of the things you want is an indispensable part of happiness.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: It is not how much we have  but how much we enjoy  that makes happiness.
author: Charles Spurgeon

quote: Before strongly desiring anything  we should look carefully into the happiness of its present owner.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: We have all been placed on this earth to discover our own path  and we will never be happy if we live someone else's idea of life.
author: James Van Praagh

quote: The grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do  something to love  and something to hope for.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: But what is happiness except the simple harmony between a man and the life he leads.
author: Albert Camus

quote: We all have 100% to deal with in our lives: 10% is important  90% unimportant. The secret to a happy  productive life is to deal with the 10% and let the 90% slip.
author: Salli Rasberry

quote: With a little discipline and regular self-checks  you can learn to do one thing at a time. And do it better. And be happier doing it.
author: Elaine St. James

quote: I've been riding the carousel in Central Park since I was five years old . . . If I'm very depressed or if something's bothering me today  my husband  Larry  and I go back to the park. We get on the carousel horse and we start riding  and I start singing at the top of my lungs. It is pure and absolute joy and happiness.
author: Eda LeShan

quote: It's never too late to have a happy childhood.
author: Anonymous

quote: Life holds so much  so much to be happy about always. Most people ask for happiness on condition. Happiness can be felt only if you don't set any conditions.
author: Artur Rubinstein

quote: Happiness is the spiritual experience of living every minute with love  grace  and gratitude.
author: Denis Waitley

quote: Better to be happy than wise.
author: John Heywood

quote: Happiness is a butterfly  which  when pursued  is always just beyond your grasp  but which  if you will sit down quietly  may alight upon you.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: Your success and happiness lie in you. Resolve to keep happy  and your joy and you shall form an invisible host against difficulties.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Remember that happiness is a way of travel  not a destination.
author: Roy Goodman

quote: When ill luck besets us  to ease the tension we have only to remember that happiness is relative. The next time you are tempted to grumble about what has happened to you  why not pause and be glad that it is no worse than it is?
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: When one door of happiness closes  another opens  but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us.
author: Helen Keller

quote: I have found that most people are about as happy as they make up their minds to be.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: It is the happiness that comes from within that is lasting and fulfilling.
author: Leddy Schmeligh

quote: Each person on this planet is inherently  intrinsically capable of attaining "dizzying heights" of happiness and fulfillment.
author: Wayne Dyer

quote: The ingredients of happiness are so simple that they can be counted on one hand. Happiness comes from within  and rests most securely on simple goodness and clear conscience.
author: William Ogden

quote: We are never so happy nor so unhappy as we imagine.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: You have to believe in happiness  or happiness never comes.
author: Douglas Malloch

quote: It is a man's proper business to seek happiness and avoid misery.
author: John Locke

quote: The best way to secure future happiness is to be as happy as is rightfully possible today.
author: Charles Eliot

quote: Why should we refuse the happiness this hour gives us  because some other hour might take it away?
author: John Oliver Hobbes

quote: At the end of our time on earth  if we have lived fully  we will not be able to say  "I was always happy." Hopefully  we will be able to say  "I have experienced a lifetime of real moments  and many of them were happy moments."
author: Barbara DeAngelis

quote: Cherish all your happy moments  they make a fine cushion for old age.
author: Booth Tarkington

quote: Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life  the whole aim and end of human existence.
author: Aristotle

quote: The time to be happy is now. The place to be happy is here.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

quote: Happiness and love are just a choice away.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: Our happiness depends on the habit of mind we cultivate. So practice happy thinking every day. Cultivate the merry heart  develop the happiness habit  and life will become a continual feast.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

quote: Humor is the healthy way of feeling "distance" between one's self and the problem  a way of standing off and looking at one's problems with perspective.
author: Rollo May

quote: Humor has great power to heal on an emotional level. You can't hold anger  you can't hold fear  you can't hold hurt while you're laughing.
author: Steve Bhaerman

quote: Humor enables one to live in the midst of tragic events without becoming a tragic figure.
author: E. T. Eberhart

quote: There is no defense against adverse fortune which is so effectual as an habitual sense of humor.
author: Thomas Higginson

quote: Humor is our way of defending ourselves from life's absurdities by thinking absurdly about them.
author: Lewis Mumford

quote: Common sense and a sense of humor are the same thing  moving at different speeds. A sense of humor is just common sense  dancing.
author: Clive James

quote: There is always something to chuckle about. Sometimes we see it. Sometimes . . . we don't. Still  the world is filled with humor. It is there when we are happy and it is there to cheer us up when we are not.
author: Allen Klein

quote: Joy is the most infallible sign of the Presence of God.
author: Teilhard de Chardin

quote: Listen to the clues. The next time you feel real joy  stop and think. Pay attention. Because joy is the universe's way of knocking on your mind's door. Hello in there. Is anyone home? Can I leave a message? Yes? Good I The message is that you are happy  and that means that you are in touch with your purpose.
author: Steve Chandler

quote: Joy of life seems to me to arise from a sense of being where one belongs ... of being foursquare with the life we have chosen. All the discontented people I know are trying sedulously to be something they are not  to do something they cannot do.
author: David Grayson

quote: When we align our thoughts  emotions  and actions with the highest part of ourselves  we are filled with enthusiasm  purpose  and meaning. . . . We are joyously and intimately engaged with our world. This is the experience of authentic power.
author: Gary Zukav

quote: We have a tendency to obscure the forest of simple joys with the trees of problems.
author: Christiane Collange

quote: People need joy quite as much as clothing. Some of them need it far more.
author: Margaret Collier Graham

quote: When large numbers of people share their joy in common  the happiness of each is greater because each adds fuel to the other's flame.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Joys divided are increased.
author: Josiah Gilbert Holland

quote: You increase your joy by increasing the pure joy of others.
author: Torkom Saraydarian

quote: Joy increases as you give it  and diminishes as you try to keep it for yourself. In giving it  you will accumulate a deposit of joy greater than you ever believed possible.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

quote: As you express joy  you draw it out of those you meet  creating joyful people and joyful events. The greater the joy you express  the more joy you experience.
author: Arnold Patent

quote: When we feel joyful  euphoric  happy  we are more open to life  more capable of seeing things clearly and handling daily tensions.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: If we could learn how to balance rest against effort  calmness against strain  quiet against turmoil  we would assure ourselves of joy in living and psychological health for life.
author: Josephine Rathbone

quote: Simplicity  clarity  singleness: these are the attributes that give our lives power and vividness and joy.
author: Richard Halloway

quote: Joy is not in things  it is in us.
author: Richard Wagner

quote: Joy is the feeling of grinning on the inside.
author: Melba Colgrove

quote: Joy is the will which labors  which overcomes obstacles  which knows triumph.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: It is in the compelling zest of high adventure and of victory  and in creative action  that man finds his supreme joy.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: I believe humans were born to have joy and to have it more abundantly  that the birthright of everyone is loving  caring  sharing  and abundance.
author: Peter McWiluams

quote: Joy is your birthright.
author: Sarah Ban Breathnach

quote: Blessed are the joymakers.
author: Nathaniel Parker Willis

quote: Although a lot can be learned from adversity  most of the same lessons can be learned through laughter and joy.
author: Peter McWilliams

quote: So when you're lonely or sad or bad or blue remember where laughter's hiding . . . it's hiding inside of YOU!
author: David Saltzman

quote: Against the assault of laughter nothing can stand.
author: Mark Twain

quote: In every job  relationship  or life situation there is inevitably some turbulence. Learn to laugh at it. It is part of what you do and who you are
author: Allen Klein

quote: Laughter puts your brain  your central nervous system and your whole being into a state of free play.
author: Max Eastman

quote: Laughing deeply is living deeply.
author: Milan Kundera

quote: It has always seemed to me that hearty laughter is a good way to jog internally without having to go outdoors.
author: Norman Cousins

quote: A good belly laugh is like taking your liver for a horseback ride.
author: Bonny Clark

quote: He laughs best whose laugh lasts.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: Shared laughter is like throwing open the shutters in a gloomy room and letting in fresh air and sunshine.
author: Lila Green

quote: Laughter is the sun that drives winter from the human race.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Shared laughter is love made audible.
author: Izzy Gesell

quote: A good laugh helps us recognize how ridiculous it is to get excited about matters that are often trivial. . . .
author: Arthur Asa Berger

quote: Laughter is the brush that sweeps away the cobwebs of the heart.
author: Mort Walker

quote: When we can laugh through our tears  we are being given a powerful message. Things may be bad  but they cannot be all that bad.
author: Allen Klein

quote: The child in you  like all children  loves to laugh  to be around people who can laugh at themselves and life. Children instinctively know that the more laughter we have in our lives  the better.
author: Wayne Dyer

quote: Laughter is a gift everyone should open.
author: Gene Mitchener

quote: In the true man there is a child concealed - who wants to play.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Play keeps us vital and alive. It gives us an enthusiasm for life that is irreplaceable. Without it  life just doesn't taste good.
author: Lucia Capacchione

quote: It's good to play  and you must keep in practice.
author: Jerry Seinfeld

quote: The supreme accomplishment is to blur the line between work and play.
author: Arnold Toynbee

quote: A little work  a little play  To keep us going - and so  good-day!
author: George Du Maurier

quote: Every time a man smiles  and much more when he laughs  it adds something to his fragment of life.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: What sunshine is to flowers  smiles are to humanity. They are but trifles  to be sure  but  scattered along life's pathway  the good they do is inconceivable.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: It's easy enough to be pleasant when everything goes like a song  but the man who is worthwhile  is the man who can smile  when everything goes dead wrong.
author: Anonymous

quote: If you have made another person on this earth smile  your life has been worthwhile.
author: Sr. Mary Christelle Macaluso

quote: Wrinkles should merely indicate where smiles have been.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Of all the things you wear  your expression is the most important.
author: Janet Lane

quote: It is only through love that we can attain to communion with God. All living knowledge of God rest upon this foundation: that we experience Him in our lives as Will-to-love.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: One word frees us of all the weight and pain of life: That word is love.
author: Sophocles

quote: It makes no difference how deeply seated may be the trouble  how hopeless the outlook  how muddled the tangle  how great the mistake. A sufficient realization of love will dissolve it all. If only you could love enough you would be the happiest and most powerful being in the world.
author: Emmet Fox

quote: Love is the master key which opens the gates of happiness.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: There is only one happiness in life  to love and be loved.
author: George Sand

quote: Let no one who loves be called unhappy. Even love unreturned has its rainbow.
author: J. M. Barrie

quote: What a grand thing  to be loved! What a grander thing still  to lovel
author: Victor Hugo

quote: To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.
author: David Viscott

quote: Love . . . binds everything together in perfect harmony.
author: Bible

quote: For love ... is the blood of life  the power of reunion in the separated.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: It is this intangible thing  love in many forms  which enters into every therapeutic relationship. . . . And it is an element which binds and heals  which comforts and restores  which works what we have to call - for now - miracles.
author: Karl Menninger

quote: This is the miracle that happens every time to those who really love  the more they give  the more they possess.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: The one thing we can never get enough of is love. And the one thing we never give enough of is love.
author: Henry Miller

quote: Love sought is good  but given unsought is better.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Don't shut love out of your life by saying it's impossible to find time. The quickest way to receive love is to give  the fastest way to lose love is to hold it too tightly  and the best way to keep love is to give it wings.
author: Brian Dyson

quote: The love we give away is the only one we keep.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: If you would be loved  love and be lovable.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: The issue is not so much being loved but being loving  which leads to the same wonderful feeling you experience when someone loves you.
author: Carol Pearson

quote: Everybody forgets the basic thing: people are not going to love you unless you love them.
author: Pat Carroll

quote: A loving person lives in a loving world. A hostile person lives in a hostile world: everyone you meet is your mirror.
author: Ken Keyes

quote: Nine times out of ten  when you extend your arms to someone  they will step in  because basically they need precisely what you need.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: Love your enemies because they bring out the best in you.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Tolerance and celebration of individual differences is the fire that fuels lasting love.
author: Tom Hannah

quote: Do not waste time bothering whether you "love" your neighbor  act as if you did. As soon as we do this we find one of the great secrets. When you are behaving as if you loved someone  you will presently come to love him.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.
author: Bible

quote: Love is a force that connects us to every strand of the universe  an unconditional state that characterizes human nature  a form of knowledge that is always there for us if only we can open ourselves to it.
author: Emily Hilburn Sell

quote: When we connect with ourselves in love  we can connect with others and the planet in love.
author: Rattana Hetzel

quote: Choose to be a love-finder rather than a faultfinder.
author: Gerald Jampolsky

quote: If you judge people  you have no time to love them.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Someday  after we have mastered the winds  the waves  the tide and gravity  we shall harness for God the energies of love. Then  for the second time in the history of the world  man will have discovered fire.
author: Teilhard de Chardin

quote: Love keeps the cold out better than a cloak.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: In the coldest February  as in every other month in every other year  the best thing to hold on to in this world is each other.
author: Linda Ellerbee

quote: True love always brings joy to ourself and to the one we love. If our love does not bring joy to both of us  it is not true love.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quote: True love comes quietly  without banners or flashing lights. If you hear bells  get your ears checked.
author: Erich Segal

quote: True love is night jasmine  a diamond in darkness  the heartbeat no cardiologist has ever heard. It is the most common of miracles  fashioned of fleecy clouds - a handful of stars tossed into the night sky.
author: Jim Bishop

quote: The essence of love is kindness.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Love is what we were born with. Fear is what we learned here.
author: Marianne Williamson

quote: Love is letting go of fear.
author: Gerald Jampolsky

quote: Love is much nicer to be in than an automobile accident  a tight girdle  a higher tax bracket  or a holding pattern over Philadelphia.
author: Judith Viorst

quote: The Eskimos had fifty-two names for snow because it was important to them  there ought to be as many for love.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: Every single one of us can do things that no one else can do can love things that no one else can love . . . We are like violins. We can be used for doorstops  or we can make music.
author: Barbara Sher

quote: But some emotions don't make a lot of noise. It's hard to hear pride. Caring is real faint - like a heartbeat. And pure love why  some days it's so quiet  you don't even know it's there.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: Love is not what we become but who we already are.
author: Stephen Levine

quote: Ultimately  love is self-approval.
author: Sondra Ray

quote: Love is  above all  the gift of oneself.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: You must love yourself before you love another. By accepting yourself and fully being what you are . . . your simple presence can make others happy.
author: Jane Roberts

quote: It is not what we do  it is how much love we put in the doing.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Forget the resolutions. Forget control and discipline . . . too much work. Instead try experimenting. Go in search of something to fall in love with. . . something about yourself  your career  your spouse.
author: Dale Dauten

quote: Find something you love to do and you'll never have to work a day in your life.
author: Harvey Mackay

quote: You will find  as you look back upon your life  that the moments when you really lived are the moments when you have done things in the spirit of love.
author: Henry Drummond

quote: We are most alive when we're in love.
author: John Updike

quote: In our life there is a single color  as on an artist's palette  which provides the meaning of life and art. It is the color of love.
author: Marc Chagall

quote: Life is a flower of which love is the honey.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: No one who has ever brought up a child can doubt for a moment that love is literally the life-giving fluid of human existence.
author: Smiley Blanton

quote: Anything will give up its secrets if you love it enough. Not only have I found that when I talk to the little flower or to the little peanut they will give up their secrets  but I have found that when I silently commune with people they give up their secrets also - if you love them enough.
author: George Washington Carver

quote: A five-word sentence that could change the world tomorrow is "What would love do now?"
author: Neale Donald Walsch

quote: Do not seek perfection in a changing world. Instead  perfect your love.
author: Master Sengstan

quote: Every day we are offered new means for learning and growing in love.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: Spend a moment  every day  thinking of someone to love.
author: Richard Carlson

quote: Ultimately love is everything.
author: M. Scott Peck

quote: What the world really needs is more love and less paperwork.
author: Pearl Bailey

quote: Love doesn't make the world go 'round. Love is what makes the ride worthwhile.
author: Franklin P. Jones

quote: Love is how you stay alive  even after you are gone.
author: Morrie Schwartz

quote: Birds of a feather flock together.
author: English proverb

quote: Like mother  like daughter.
author: English proverb

quote: One crow will not pick out another crow's eyes.
author: English proverb

quote: Like will to like  each creature loves his kind.
author: Robert Herrick

quote: Like father  like son.
author: Latin proverb

quote: I shall not look upon his like again.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: His heart was as great as the world  but there was no room in it to hold the memory of a wrong.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Honesty rare as a man without self-pity  Kindness as large and plain as a prairie wind.
author: Stephen Vincent

quote: The port is near  the bells I hear  the people all exulting  While follow eyes the steady keel  the vessel grim and daring  But O heart! heart! heart! O the bleeding drops of red  Where on the deck my captain lies  Fallen cold and dead.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: The lion is not so fierce as they paint him.
author: George Edward Herbert

quote: Do not pluck the beard of a dead lion.
author: Martial

quote: A lion among ladies is a most dreadful thing.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: It is not good to wake a sleeping lion.
author: Philip Sidney

quote: From listening comes wisdom  and from speaking repentance.
author: Italian proverb

quote: A good listener is not only popular everywhere  but after a while he knows something.
author: Wilson Mizner

quote: I am never long  even in the society of her I love  without yearning for the company of my lamp and my library.
author: Lord Byron

quote: The walls are the publishers of the poor.
author: Eduardo Galeano

quote: A novel is a static thing that one moves through  a play is a dynamic thing that moves past one.
author: Kenneth Tynan

quote: Chaucer  I confess  is a rough diamond  and must be polished e'er he shines.
author: John Dryden

quote: I can find my biography in every fable that I read.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Literature is mostly about sex and not much about having children  and life is the other way around.
author: David Lodge

quote: Literature is my utopia.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Literature is the art of writing something that will be read twice  journalism what will be grasped at once.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: Literature was formerly an art and finance a trade: today it is the reverse.
author: Joseph Roux

quote: Oh! Let us never  never doubt What nobody is sure about.
author: Hilaire Belloc

quote: Science is uneasy with beginnings. Mythology is concerned above all with what happened "in the beginning". Its signature is "Once upon a time".
author: Dudley Young

quote: The first thing to be done by a biographer in estimating character is to examine the stubs of the victim's cheque books.
author: Silas W. Mitchell

quote: The llama is a woolly sort of fleecy hairy goat  with an indolent expression and an undulating throat like an unsuccessful literary man.
author: Hilaire Belloc

quote: The universe is made up of stories  not of atoms.
author: Muriel Rukeyser

quote: Those expressions are omitted which cannot with propriety be read aloud in the family.
author: Dr. Thomas Bowdler

quote: What is a diary as a rule? A document useful to the person who keeps it  dull to the contemporary who reads it and invaluable to the student  centuries afterwards  who treasures it!
author: Helen Terry

quote: When a man can observe himself suffering and is able  later  to describe what he's gone through  it means he was born for literature.
author: Edouard Bourdet

quote: When I read Shakespeare I am struck with wonder that such trivial people should muse and thunder in such lovely language.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: Literature is the effort of man to indemnify himself for the wrongs of his condition.
author: Walter Savage Landor

quote: The short story is the art form that deals with the individual when there is no longer a society to absorb him  and when he is compelled to exist  as it were  by his own inner light.
author: Frank O'Connor

quote: A novel is a mirror carried along a main road.
author: Stendhal

quote: A novel is never anything but a philosophy put into images.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Biographies are but the clothes and buttons of the man - the biography of the man himself cannot be written.
author: Mark Twain

quote: What is an epigram? A dwarfish whole  its body brevity  and wit its soul.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: A literary movement consists of five or six people who live in the same town and hate each other cordially.
author: George Moore

quote: Literature is a power to be possessed  not a body of objects to be studied.
author: Anonymous

quote: Fiction reveals truth that reality obscures.
author: Jessamyn West

quote: A perfect judge will read each word of wit with the same spirit that its author writ.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: In literary history  generation follows generation in a rage.
author: Annie Dillard

quote: To be a good diarist  one must have a little snouty  sneaky mind.
author: Harold Nicolson

quote: Published memoirs indicate the end of a man's activity  and that he acknowledges the end.
author: George Meredith

quote: It has come to be practically a sort of rule in literature that a man  having once shown himself capable of original writing  is entitled thenceforth to steal from the writings of others at discretion.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The novel is a prose narrative of some length that has something wrong with it.
author: Randall Jarrell

quote: All that non-fiction can do is answer questions. It's fiction's business to ask them.
author: Richard Hughes

quote: Contemporary literature can be classified under three headings: the neurotic  the erotic and the tommy-rotic.
author: W. Giese

quote: Literature is the orchestration of platitudes.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: Medicine is my lawful wife. Literature is my mistress.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: One hears about life all the time from different people with very different narrative gifts.
author: Anthony Powell

quote: The essay is a literary device for saying almost everything about almost anything.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: The answers you get from literature depend upon the questions you pose.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: The classics are only primitive literature. They belong to the same class as primitive machinery and primitive music and primitive medicine.
author: Stephen Leacock

quote: Biography is one of the new terrors of death.
author: John Arbuthnot

quote: A biography is considered complete if it merely accounts for six or seven selves  whereas a person may well have as many as a thousand.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: In literature as in love we are astounded by what is chosen by others.
author: Andre Maurois

quote: Good children's literature appeals not only to the child in the adult  but to the adult in the child.
author: Anonymous

quote: Literature flourishes best when it is half a trade and half an art.
author: Dean William R. Inge

quote: The great standard of literature as to purity and exactness of style is the Bible.
author: Hugh Blair

quote: The man who writes about himself and his own time is the only man who writes about all people and about all time.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Literature is my Utopia. Here I am not disfranchised. No barrier of the senses shuts me out from the sweet  gracious discourse of my book-friends. They talk to me without embarrassment or awkwardness.
author: Helen Keller

quote: The classics are only primitive literature. They belong to the same class as primitive machinery and primitive music and primitive medicine.
author: Stephen Leacock

quote: The difference between literature and journalism is that journalism is unreadable  and literature is not read.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Logic is logic. That's all I say.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Logic is neither a science nor an art  but a dodge.
author: Benjamin Jowett

quote: Grammar is the logic of speech  even as logic is the grammar of reason.
author: Richard Trench

quote: A mighty mass of brick  and smoke  and shipping  Dirty and dusty  but as wide as eye Could reach  with here and there a sail just skipping In sight  then lost amidst the forestry Of masts  a wilderness of steeples peeping On tiptoe through their sea-coal canopy  A huge  dun cupola  like a fools-cap crown On a fool's head - and there is London Town.
author: Lord Byron

quote: London is a roost  for every bird.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Jealousy is no more than feeling alone against smiling enemies.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: To be adult is to be alone (etre adulte  c'est etre seul).
author: Jean Rostand

quote: What loneliness is more lonely than distrust.
author: George Eliot

quote: Loneliness is and always has been the central and inevitable experience of every man.
author: Thomas Wolfe

quote: One may have a blazing hearth in one's soul  and yet no one ever comes to sit by it.
author: Vincent van Gogh

quote: So lonely 'twas that God himself scarce seemed there to be.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: The lonely one offers his hand too quickly to whomever he encounters.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Man's loneliness is but his fear of life.
author: Eugene O'Neill

quote: No man is an Island intire of it self  every man is a peece of the Continent  a part of the maine  if a Clod be washed away by the sea  Europe is the lesse  as well as if a Promontorie were  as well as if a manor of thy friends or thine own were. Any man's death diminishes me because I am involved in Mankinde  and therefore never send to know for whom the bell tolls  it tolls for thee.
author: John Donne

quote: Who knows what true loneliness is - not the conventional word but the naked terror? To the lonely themselves it wears a mask. The most miserable outcast hugs some memory or some illusion.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: Little do men perceive what solitude is  and how far it extendeth. For a crowd is not company  and faces are but a gallery of pictures  and talk but a tinkling cymbal  where there is no love.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Where you used to be  there is a hole in the world  which I find myself constantly walking around in the daytime  and falling into at night. I miss you like hell.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote: The eternal quest of the individual human being is to shatter his loneliness.
author: Norman Cousins

quote: Language has created the word 'loneliness' to express the pain of being alone  and the word 'solitude' to express the glory of being alone.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: If I'm such a legend  then why am I so lonely? Let me tell you  legends are all very well if you've got somebody around who loves you.
author: Judy Garland

quote: Loneliness and the feeling of being unwanted is the most terrible poverty.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Did you ever have one of those nights when you didn't want to go out  but your hair looked too good to stay home?
author: Jack Simmons

quote: I base most of my fashion taste on what doesn't itch.
author: Gilda Radner

quote: The only thing that can stop hair from falling ... is the floor.
author: Will Rogers

quote: I'm not offended by all the dumb blonde jokes because I know I'm not dumb . . . and I also know that I'm not blonde.
author: Dolly Parton

quote: It's good to know that there's a fine line between an "outfit" and a "getup."
author: Linda Merkin

quote: Her figure is harder to ignore than a ringing telephone.
author: Anonymous

quote: What a man enjoys about a woman's clothes are his fantasies of how she would look without them.
author: Brendan Francis

quote: A big advantage of being bald is that you can style your hair with a damp cloth.
author: Anonymous

quote: His toupee makes him look twenty years sillier.
author: Bill Dana

quote: The most delightful advantage of being bald one can hear the snowflakes.
author: R. G. Daniels

quote: He looked as if he had been poured into his clothes and had forgotten to say "when."
author: P. G. Wodehouse

quote: I've put on a lot of weight... I only weighed six and a half pounds when I was born.
author: Red Skelton

quote: They say tall people live a lot longer than short people. No they don't. They're just so irritating it seems they are around a lot longer.
author: Margaret Smith

quote: I'm tired of all this nonsense about beauty being only skin deep. That's deep enough. What do you want  an adorable pancreas?
author: Jean Kerr

quote: My sister says she never seems to get it together . . . either her rear looks good or her face does.
author: Sally Bucko

quote: He has more chins than a Chinese phone book.
author: Joan Rivers

quote: I look just like the girl next door ... if you happen to live next door to an amusement park.
author: Dolly Parton

quote: It's not wrinkles. I just have too much skin for the size of my face.
author: Barbara Colson

quote: Today at the beach I could feel the men dressing me with their eyes.
author: Jere Carlson

quote: I resent my barber when he charges the full cost after he cuts my hair  but he says he's charging me for finding it.
author: Tim Conway

quote: Definition of a bridegroom: A man who is amazed at the outcome of what he thought was a harmless little flirtation.
author: Anonymous

quote: After fifteen years of marriage  my wife wants us to recommit our vows. As a man  I don't understand her need to get married again. We've got our toaster  let's move on.
author: Robert G. Lee

quote: We have found that the best way for our marriage to work is to let me make the big decisions and my wife the small ones. With this system  I'm noticing  there are usually no big ones.
author: Tom Kardashian

quote: Before criticizing your wife's faults  remember that they may have prevented her from getting a better husband.
author: Anonymous

quote: When you see a married couple coming down the street  the one who is two or three steps ahead is the one who's mad.
author: Anonymous

quote: It's not that I'm too particular. It's just that I'm going to wait for Dr. Right.
author: Anonymous

quote: When I married Mr. Right  I didn't know his first name was Always.
author: Anne Gilchrist

quote: Love is like the measles. The older you get it  the worse the attack.
author: Mary Roberts Rinehart

quote: I wanted to marry her when I saw the moonlight shining on the barrel of her father's shotgun.
author: Eddie Albert

quote: If love is the answer  could you rephrase the question?
author: Lily Tomlin

quote: I don't know which was worse  the cost of the bridesmaid dress or having to wear it.
author: Debbie Etchings

quote: I was the best man at the wedding. So why is she marrying him?
author: Jerry Seinfeld

quote: A bachelor is a man who has to know how to remove a coffee stain  from a catsup stain  from a silk tie.
author: Dan Bennett

quote: I don't like being best man at a wedding 'cause there's no way to prove it.
author: Anonymous

quote: A bachelor is a man who can take a nap on top of a bedspread.
author: Marcelene Cox

quote: Definition of a bachelor: A man who likes to invite girls over for a Scotch and sofa.
author: Anonymous

quote: Father giving advice to son: Never do anything once around the house that you don't want to do for the rest of your life.
author: Frank Briggs

quote: No woman ever shot her husband while he was doing the dishes.
author: Anonymous

quote: The groom is so much better for her than her last boyfriend. He's sophisticated  he brings her flowers and candy  he dines by candlelight. Her last boyfriend thought it was enough to spray her name on a fence.
author: Tim Conway

quote: I have learned that only two things are necessary to keep one's wife happy. First  let her think she's having her way. And second  let her have it.
author: Lyndon Johnson

quote: The last word in an argument is what a wife has. Anything a husband says after that is the beginning of another argument.
author: Anonymous

quote: My wife thinks I'm too nosy. At least that's what she writes in her diary.
author: Drake Sather

quote: He loved her for what she was - rich. He worshiped the ground her family struck oil on.
author: Anonymous

quote: No man is boss in his own home  but he can make up for it  by making a dog play dead.
author: W. C. Fields

quote: Marriage is like a violin. After the beautiful music is over  the strings are still attached.
author: Jacob Braude

quote: My husband will never chase another woman. He's too fine  too decent  too old.
author: Grade Allen

quote: Marriage is a great institution  but I'm not ready for an institution.
author: Mae West

quote: We're having a little disagreement. What I want is a big church wedding with bridesmaids and flowers and a no-expense-spared reception  and what he wants is to break off our engagement.
author: Sally Poplin

quote: What do you call a woman who knows where her husband is at all times? A widow.
author: Anonymous

quote: My wife and I just celebrated our twelfth anniversary. I'm Catholic  so there's no real possibility of divorce. I'm Irish - so there is the possibility of murder.
author: J. J. Wall

quote: My wife is the most wonderful woman in the world  and that's not just my opinion - it's hers.
author: Anonymous

quote: 'Tis more blessed to give than to receive  for example  wedding presents.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Arguing with my wife is like this: "I came! I saw! I concurred!"
author: Anonymous

quote: Our marriage is based on compromise-he admits he's wrong and I forgive him.
author: Carol Spieker

quote: My wife and I have many arguments  but she only wins half of them. My mother-in-law wins the other half.
author: Terry Bechtol

quote: I can always tell what kind of a time I'm having at a party by the look on my wife's face.
author: John Bedrosian

quote: We never get sick of each other. That's how sick we are.
author: Roseanne Barr

quote: I'd like to go to assertiveness training class. First I need to check with my wife.
author: Adam Christing

quote: A smart husband buys his wife very fine china so she won't trust him to wash it.
author: Anonymous

quote: Never get married in the morning  because you never know who you'll meet that night.
author: Paul Hornung

quote: When I met Jean  I felt God reach down out of the sky  pull my hair  and say  "This one  dummy."
author: Richard Atcheson

quote: They were married for better or worse. He couldn't have done better  and she couldn't have done worse.
author: Anonymous

quote: she: Before we got married  you told me you were well-off. he: I was  and I didn't know it.
author: Jacob Braude

quote: When my wife was asked  "Do you take this man for richer or poorer . . ." she answered  "For richer."
author: Anonymous

quote: It is assumed that the woman must wait motionless until she is wooed. That is how the spider waits for the fly.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The man who boasts he never made a mistake is often married to the woman who did.
author: Anonymous

quote: Often the difference between a successful marriage and a mediocre one consists of leaving about three or four things a day unsaid.
author: Harlan Miller

quote: True love comes quietly  without banners or flashing lights. If you hear bells  get your ears checked.
author: Erich Segal

quote: You can easily tell he's a newlywed  because he's still smiling at his mother-in-law.
author: Elmer Pasta

quote: "So you want to become my son-in-law." "Not exactly. I just want to marry your daughter."
author: Anonymous

quote: You need that guy like a giraffe needs a strep throat.
author: Ann Landers

quote: When a man brings his wife flowers for no reason - there's a reason.
author: Molly McGee

quote: I do not spoil women. ... I don't send them flowers and gifts. . . . I'm saving those gestures until I am an unpleasant old man who must resort to bribery to win a woman's synthetic affections.
author: George Sanders

quote: Men would like monogamy better if it sounded less like monotony.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: Never go to bed mad. Stay up and fight.
author: Phyllis Diller

quote: Many a man has fallen in love with a girl in a light so dim he would not have chosen a suit by it.
author: Maurice Chevalier

quote: A good marriage would be between a blind wife and a deaf husband.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: The great secret of a successful marriage is to treat all disasters as incidents and none of the incidents as disasters.
author: Harold Nicolson

quote: This is a perfect pair - he's a hypochondriac and she's a pill.
author: Anonymous

quote: I haven't spoken to my wife in years-I didn't want to interrupt her.
author: Rodney Dangerfield

quote: Her idea of a romantic setting is one that has a diamond in it. If you feel the need to marry a doctor  I suggest a dermatologist. Good hours  free Retin-A.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: Advice to son: Never confuse "I love you" with "I want to marry you."
author: Cleveland Amory

quote: Living with a saint is more grueling than being one.
author: Robert Neville

quote: God help the man who won't marry until he finds a perfect woman  and God help him still more if he finds her.
author: Ben Tillet

quote: My husband yells comments like "How long till you're ready? Throw out a date."
author: Wendy Morgan

quote: I had a terrible fight with my wife on New Year's Eve. She called me a procrastinator. So I finished addressing the Christmas cards and left.
author: Robert Orben

quote: Keeping a secret from my wife is like trying to smuggle daylight past a rooster. Annoyed wife to husband: Can't you just say we've been married twenty-four years instead of "almost a quarter of a century"?
author: Anonymous

quote: After paying for the wedding  about all a father has left to give away is the bride.
author: Ned Spieker

quote: She represents the country Alamonia.
author: David Letterman

quote: A wedding invitation is sent by people who have been saying  "Do we have to ask them?" to people whose first response is  "How much do you think we have to spend on them?"
author: Judith Martin

quote: You may marry the man of your dreams  ladies  but fourteen years later you're married to a couch that burps.
author: Roseanne Barr

quote: I never married because there was no need. I have three pets at home that answer the same purpose as a husband. I have a dog that growls every morning  a parrot that swears all afternoon  and a cat that comes home late at night.
author: Marie Corelli

quote: The difference between being in a relationship and being in prison is that in prison they let you play Softball on the weekends.
author: Bobby Kelton

quote: My wife  Mary  and I have been married for forty-seven years  and not once have we had an argument serious enough to consider divorce  murder  yes  but divorce  never.
author: Jack Benny

quote: Let me give you an idea how long ago they got married. You know where they met? . . . At a Cubs World Series game.
author: Jay Leno

quote: You might try doing what my folks did. Twice a week they would go out for a special meal. . . with wine  good food  and soft lighting. Dad took Tuesday and Mom took Thursday.
author: Anonymous

quote: He had a great sound system - but he didn't know much about fidelity.
author: Anonymous

quote: Getting married is a good deal like going to a restaurant with your friends. You order what you want  and then when you see what the other fellow got  you wish you had taken that.
author: Clarence Darrow

quote: Prenuptial agreement: Paper a lawyer prepares to protect the party of the first part from the party of the second part should they discover the party's over.
author: Rheta G. Johnson

quote: After our honeymoon I felt like a new man. She said she did too.
author: Anonymous

quote: I never hated a man enough to give him his diamonds back.
author: Zsa Zsa Gabor

quote: We've never been happier. Things are great. . . I just don't go into her part of the house.
author: Buddy Hackett

quote: My wife divorced me because of illness. She got sick of me.
author: Anonymous

quote: A friend of mine hated her husband so much that when he died she had him cremated  blended him with marijuana  and smoked him. She said  "That's the best he's made me feel in years."
author: Maureen Murphy

quote: We split up over religious differences - she worshiped money . . . and I didn't have any.
author: B. J. Cole

quote: I've had bad luck with both my wives. The first divorced me and the second won't.
author: Anonymous

quote: For their last anniversary  she gave him a set of luggage - packed.
author: Anonymous

quote: God  this request isn't for me  it's for my mom. . . . Could you send her a son-in-law?
author: Lane Lenhart

quote: Somehow there was a lack of communication -  She thought he said: "Till debt do us part."
author: Brian Morgan

quote: A faithful husband is one whose alimony check is always on time.
author: Anonymous

quote: The clearest explanation for the failure of any marriage is that two people are incompatible  that is  one is male and the other female.
author: Anna Quindlen

quote: A lot of people have asked me how short I am. Since my last divorce  I think I'm about a hundred thousand dollars short.
author: Mickey Rooney

quote: My sister started to smell trouble when on the second day of her honeymoon the groom started asking for separate checks.
author: Wendy Morgan

quote: I remember when I got married. I remember where I got married. But for the life of me  I can't remember why I got married.
author: Anonymous

quote: I've married a few people I shouldn't have  but haven't we all?
author: Mamie Van Doren

quote: Not all of his relationships were meant to end . . . Once he sent a postcard and inadvertently wrote "Wish you were her."
author: Anonymous

quote: My second ex-wife was really kind of like a ship passing in the night. Only she turned out to be the Exxon Valdez.
author: James Woods

quote: Wives are people who feel they don't dance enough.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: Going shopping with your husband is like his going fishing with the game warden.
author: Anonymous

quote: My wife and I had words -  but I never got to use mine.
author: Fibber McGee

quote: 'Tis not love's going hurts my days  but that it went in little ways.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote: After all  my erstwhile dear  my no longer cherished  need we say it was no love  just because it perished?
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote: Alas!  how light a cause may move dissention between hearts that love!
author: Thomas More

quote: Every theory of love  from Plato down  teaches that each individual loves in the other sex what he lacks in himself.
author: G. Stanley Hall

quote: If we all discovered that we had only five minutes left to say all that we wanted to say  every telephone booth would be occupied by people calling other people to tell them that they loved them.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: Immature love says "I love you because I need you." Mature love says "I need you because I love you."
author: Erich Fromm

quote: Love doesn't grow on the trees like apples in Eden - it's something you have to make and you must use your imagination to make it too  just like anything else. It's all work  work.
author: Joyce Carey

quote: Love is a kind of military service.
author: Latin proverb

quote: Love is nature's second son.
author: George Chapman

quote: Love is not love which alters when it alteration finds.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Love is the delusion that one woman differs from another.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Love is the irresistible desire to be desired irresistibly.
author: Louis Ginsberg

quote: Love makes the time pass. Time makes love pass.
author: French proverb

quote: Love rules without rules. (Amore regge senza legge.)
author: Italian proverb

quote: Love  the itch  and a cough cannot be hid.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: What we call love is the desire to awaken and to keep awake in another's body  heart and mind  the responsibility of flattering  in our place  the self of which we are not very certain.
author: Paul Geraldy

quote: When one loves somebody  everything is clear - where to go  what to do - it all takes care of itself and one doesn't have to ask anybody about anything.
author: Maxim Gorky

quote: Where love rules  there is no will to power and where power predominates  love is lacking. The one is the shadow of the other.
author: Carl G. Jung

quote: Where there is love  there is pain.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: Love consists in this  that two solitudes protect and touch and greet each other.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: No one has ever loved anyone the way everyone wants to be loved.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: We always deceive ourselves twice about the people we love - first to their advantage  then to their disadvantage.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Human love is often but the encounter of two weaknesses.
author: Franqois Mauriac

quote: I am two fools  I know  for loving  and saying so.
author: John Donne

quote: The supreme happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: What dire offence from am'rous causes springs. What mighty contests rise from trivial things.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: From success you get a lot of things  but not that great inside thing that love brings you.
author: Sam Goldwyn

quote: He who loves the more is the inferior and must suffer.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: Love  you know  seeks to make happy rather than to be happy.
author: Ralph Connor

quote: Love is a spendthrift  leaves its arithmetic at home  is always 'in the red'.
author: Paul Scherer

quote: The loving are the daring.
author: Bayard Taylor

quote: The porcupine  whom one must handle gloved  may be respected  but is never loved.
author: Arthur Guiterman

quote: Little privations are easily endured when the heart is better treated than the body.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: No love  no friendship can cross the path of our destiny without leaving some mark on it forever.
author: Francois Mauriac

quote: There is no fear in love  but perfect love casteth out fear.
author: Bible

quote: I no longer cared about survival - I merely loved.
author: Loren Eiseley

quote: You can always get someone to love you - even if you have to do it yourself.
author: Tom Masson

quote: You've got to love what's lovable  and hate what's hateable. It takes brains to see the difference.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Romance without finance is no good.
author: Willie The Lion' Smith

quote: To live is like to love - all reason is against it  and all healthy instinct for it.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: People who throw kisses are hopelessly lazy.
author: Bob Hope

quote: Wine comes in at the mouth and love comes in at the eye  that's all we shall know for truth before we grow old and die.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: Love lives on propinquity  but dies on contact.
author: Thomas Hardy

quote: The heart that has truly loved never forgets but as truly loves on to the close.
author: Thomas More

quote: When the satisfaction or the security of another person becomes as significant to one as one's own satisfaction or security  then the state of love exists.
author: Henry Stack Sullivan

quote: At the end of what is called the 'sexual life' the only love which has lasted is the love which has everything  every disappointment  every failure and every betrayal  which has accepted even the sad fact that in the end there is no desire so deep as the simple desire for companionship.
author: Graham Greene

quote: When love and skill work together expect a masterpiece.
author: John Ruskin

quote: The greater love is a mother's  then comes a dog's  then a sweetheart's.
author: Polish proverb

quote: Selfishness is one of the qualities apt to inspire love.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: There can be no peace of mind in love  since the advantage one has secured is never anything but a fresh starting-point for further desires.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: Love does not consist in gazing at each other  but in looking together in the same direction.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: The magic of first love is our ignorance that it can ever end.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: What we can do for another is the test of powers  what we can suffer is the test of love.
author: Brooke Foss Westcott

quote: They gave each other a smile with a future in it.
author: Ring Lardner

quote: Many a man in love with a dimple makes the mistake of marrying the whole girl.
author: Stephen Leacock

quote: There is one who kisses  and the other who offers a cheek.
author: French proverb

quote: The irony of love is that it guarantees some degree of anger  fear and criticism.
author: Harold H. Bloomfield

quote: It has been wisely said that we cannot really love anybody at whom we never laugh.
author: Agnes Repplier

quote: The entire sum of existence is the magic of being needed by just one person.
author: Vi Putnam

quote: A lady of forty-seven who has been married twenty-seven years and has six children knows what love really is and once described it for me like this: 'Love is what you've been through with somebody.'
author: James Thurber

quote: And if I loved you Wednesday  well  what is that to you? I do not love you Thursday - so much is true.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote: Happiness comes more from loving than being loved  and often when our affection seems wounded it is only our vanity bleeding. To love  and to be hurt often  and to love again - this is the brave and happy life.
author: J. E. Buckrose

quote: If you cannot inspire a woman with love of you  fill her above the brim with love of herself  all that runs over will be yours.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: No one can do me any good by loving me  I have more love than I need or could do any good with  but people do me good by making me love them - which isn't easy.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Love is a gross exaggeration of the difference between one person and everybody else.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Respect is love in plain clothes.
author: Frankie Byrne

quote: A man is only as good as what he loves.
author: Saul Bellow

quote: In the act of loving someone you arm them against you.
author: Anonymous

quote: If you want to be loved  be lovable.
author: Ovid

quote: The one thing we can never get enough of is love. And the one thing we never give enough of is love.
author: Henry Miller

quote: Love makes of the wisest man a fool  and of the most foolish woman  a sage.
author: Moritz G. Saphir

quote: In how many lives does Love really play a dominant part? The average taxpayer is no more capable of a 'grand passion' than of a grand opera.
author: Israel Zangwill

quote: Love  all love of other sights controls. And makes one little room an everywhere.
author: John Donne

quote: If we are to judge of love by its consequences  it more nearly resembles hatred than friendship.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: Love cannot accept what it is. Everywhere on earth it cries out against kindness  compassion  intelligence  everything that leads to compromise. Love demands the impossible  the absolute  the sky on fire  inexhaustible springtime  life after death  and death itself transfigured into eternal life.
author: Albert Camus

quote: unlove's the heavenless hell and homeless home . . . lovers alone wear sunlight.
author: e. e. cummings

quote: The sweetest joy  the wildest woe is love.
author: Francis Bailey

quote: Man loves little and often  woman much and rarely.
author: Anonymous

quote: Love in France is a comedy  in England a tragedy  in Italy an opera seria  and in Germany a melodrama.
author: Marguerite Blessington

quote: Our first and last love is - self-love.
author: Christian Nestell Bovee

quote: The first sigh of love is the last of wisdom.
author: Antoine Bret

quote: Oh my luve's like a red  red rose  That's newly sprung in June  Oh my luve's like the melodie That's sweetly played in tune.
author: James Drummond Burns

quote: Man's love is of man's life a thing apart  'Tis woman's whole existence.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Of all the girls that are so smart There's none like pretty Sally  She is the darling of my heart  And lives in our alley.
author: Henry Carey

quote: There's no love lost between us.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: All thoughts  all passions  all delights  Whatever stirs this mortal frame  All are but ministers of Love  And feed his sacred flame.
author: Hartley Coleridge

quote: Heaven has no rage like love to hatred turned.
author: William Congreve

quote: How wise are they that are but fools in love!
author: Joshua Cooke

quote: Love with men is not a sentiment  but an idea.
author: Mme. de Girardin

quote: Love is an ocean of emotions  entirely surrounded by expenses.
author: Lord Dewar

quote: We are all born for love  ... It is the principle of existence and its only end.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: If yet I have not all thy love  love Dear  I shall never have it all.
author: John Donne

quote: But one always returns to one's first loves.
author: Etienne

quote: If you would be loved  love and be lovable.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: It's love  it's love that makes the world go round.
author: French Song

quote: All mankind love a lover.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Young men wish: love  money and health. One day  they'll say: health  money and love.
author: Paul Geraldy

quote: Man begins by loving love and ends by loving a woman. Woman begins by loving a man and ends by loving love.
author: Remy de Gourmont

quote: Whom the Lord loveth he chasteneth.
author: Hebrews

quote: You say to me-ward's your affection's strong  Pray love me little  so you love me long.
author: Robert Herrick

quote: Love is a conflict between reflexes and reflections.
author: Magnus Hirschfeld

quote: Pale hands I loved beside the Shalimar  Where are you now? Who lies beneath your spell? Whom do you lead on Rapture's roadway  far  Before you agonize them in farewell?
author: Laurence Hope

quote: There is no fear in love  but perfect love casteth out fear.
author: Anonymous

quote: Love's like the measles - all the worse when it comes late in life.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: Greater love hath no man than this  that a man lay down his life for his friends.
author: Bible

quote: Love in a hut  with water and a crust  Is - Love  forgive us! - cinders  ashes  dust.
author: John Keats

quote: Sing  for faith and hope are high -  None so true as you and I -  Sing the Lovers' Litany: "Love like ours can never die!"
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: The reason why lovers and their mistresses never tire of being together is that they are always talking of themselves.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: I could not love thee  dear  so much Loved I not honour more.
author: Richard Lovelace

quote: I love a lassie  a bonnie  bonnie lassie  She's as pure as the lily in the dell. She's as sweet as the heather  The bonnie  bloomin' heather  Mary  ma Scotch Blue-bell.
author: Harry Lauder

quote: Come live with me  and be my love  And we will all the pleasures prove  That valleys  groves  or hills  or fields  Or woods and steepy mountains  yield.
author: Christopher Marlowe

quote: He who for love hath undergone The worst that can befall  Is happier thousandfold than one Who never loved at all.
author: Richard Monckton Milnes

quote: So dear I love him  that with him all deaths I could endure  without him live no life.
author: John Milton

quote: Love is often a fruit of marriage.
author: Moliere

quote: But there's nothing half so sweet in life As love's young dream.
author: George Moore

quote: The only victory over love is flight.
author: Napoleon

quote: Love - a grave mental disease.
author: Plato

quote: Everybody in love is blind.
author: Propertius

quote: Better is a dinner of herbs where love is  than a stalled ox and hatred therewith.
author: Proverbs

quote: As one who cons at evening o'er an album all alone  And muses on the faces of the friends that he has known  So I turn the leaves of Fancy  till in shadowy design I find the smiling features of an old sweetheart of mine.
author: James Whitcomb Riley

quote: Love must have wings to fly away from love  And to fly back again.
author: Edwin Arlington Robinson

quote: Love is the fulfilling of the law.
author: Romans

quote: The hours I spent with thee  dear heart  Are as a string of pearls to me  I could them over  every one apart  My rosary  my rosary.
author: Robert Cameron Rogers

quote: And love is loveliest when embalm'd in tears.
author: Walter Scott

quote: Men have died from time to time  and worms have eaten them - but not for love.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Ay me! for aught that I ever could read  Could ever hear by tale or history  The course of true love never did run smooth.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Give me my Romeo  and  when he shall die. Take him  and cut him out in little stars  And he will make the face of heaven so fine  That all the world will be in love with night  And pay no worship to the garish sun.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Whither thou goest  I will go  and where thou lodgest  I will lodge  thy people shall be my people  and thy God my God.
author: Bible

quote: Love sought is good  but given unsought is better.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The fickleness of the woman I love is equalled by the infernal constancy of the women who love me.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Love is strong as death  jealousy is cruel as the grave.
author: Bible

quote: Many waters cannot quench love  neither can the floods drown it.
author: Bible

quote: Blue eyes say  "Love me or I die"  black eyes say  "Love me or I kill thee."
author: Spanish proverb

quote: To love her was a liberal education.
author: Richard Steele

quote: Some pray to marry the man they love  My prayer will somewhat vary: I humbly pray to Heaven above That I love the man I marry.
author: Rose Pastor Stokes

quote: 'Tis better to have loved and lost  Than never to have loved at all.
author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

quote: "I'm sorry that I spell'd the word  I hate to go above you  Because" - the brown eyes lower fell  -  "Because  you see  I love you!"
author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quote: Werther had a love for Charlotte  Such as words could never utter  Would you know how first he met her? She was cutting bread and butter.
author: William Thackeray

quote: Love in its essence is spiritual fire.
author: Emmanuel Swedenborg

quote: Luck is everything. ... My good luck in life was to be a really frightened person. I'm fortunate to be a coward  to have a low threshold of fear  because a hero couldn't make a good suspense film.
author: Alfred Hitchcock

quote: Most of life is choices  and the rest is pure dumb luck.
author: Marian Erickson

quote: Exceptional talent does not always win its reward unless favoured by exceptional circumstances.
author: Mary Elizabeth Braddon

quote: I would rather have a lucky general than a smart general. ... They win battles  and they make me lucky.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
